casebody.data:
JONES
v.
CITY OF DURHAM. No. 137A05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 30, 2006. Stewart W. Fisher, Carlos E. Mahoney, William S. Mills, Robert B. Glenn, Durham, for Linda Jones. Reginald B. Gillespie, Jr., O. William Faison, Durham, for City of Durham. Mark A. Davis, James B. Blackburn, Raleigh, for County Commissioners, et al. Bradley N. Schulz, Maria Mobley, Smithfield, for North Carolina Academy of Trial Lawyers. Andrew J. Romanet, Jr., for NC League of Municipalities. Arnetta J. Herring, Debra Bechtel, County Attorney, Bill Little, Assistant City Attorney, Mark Newbold, Deputy City Attorney/Police, for NCAPA. Edmond W. Caldwell, Jr., Executive Vice Pres./General Counsel, for NC Sheriff's Asso.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 26th day of May 2006 *100by NC Sheriffs' Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 30th day of May 2006."
